title: Product Development Engineer with focus Manufacturing
description:
About the job
Your working environment

As a Manufacturing Engineer within D&E Berlin you’ll help ASML to solve some of the most complex challenges in the semiconductor industry. You’ll work on the most important components of the wafer stage and contribute to the performance of the scanner. With your help, we can ensure that our chipmaking systems work as they should. Be part of the technology innovation that’s moving the world forward!

Your tasks

As a Manufacturing Engineer your tasks will be:

Contribution to the process chain development.
Analysis of process risks for product manufacturability e.g. contribution to the Process-FMEA overview and delivery, together with architect / lead engineer.
Detail out the manufacturing concepts based on given requirements.
Feedback to functional group on the impact of the manufacturing process on product function.
Supervise prototypes especially with regard to issues and their analysis, be physically present at the shop floor with the prototypes in case of issues such as deviations from specification.
Trigger and support process improvements according to the needs of the prototypes in collaboration with Product Development Technology, operations e.g. Produktverantwortlicher, Prozessingenieur and other operators.
Build up documentation of the process chain and process steps in total or sub sections to be handed over to production:
Documentation of prototype trouble shootings and findings (initiate Problem, Containment, Cause, Solution, Implementation, work on issue resolution management) 
Cycle Time definition and documentation, Visual Inspection for Prototypes, Delivery of NPI Proto manufacturing documentation.
Working in interdisciplinary, cross-departmental teams.
Represent development project on the shopfloor.

Your Qualifications

You have a Bachelor or master in physics, mechanical engineering, material science, or a comparable technical diploma with a strong background in mechanics.
You have knowledge or practical experience in product development for precision engineering 
You have knowledge of advanced manufacturing technologies connected to polishing, milling, surface coatings etc. and specifically for processing brittle materials. 
You have in-depth understanding of the physical properties of glass, ceramics, and glass-ceramics.
You have Experience in qualification and surface measurement technologies.
You have good communication skills in German and English.

Your Skills

You are highly proactive and collaborative, you thrive in an environment which requires that you drive your own deliverables.
You have a hands-on mentality to do things with qualities in both, practical skills and structured documentation.
Willingness to grow and advance in your own professional expertise. 

Further informationAre you interested? - Then apply now using our online application form, stating your expected salary as well as your earliest joining date.

Diversity and inclusion ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company. What we offer you
Job with bright future prospects at the leader of innovation in the semiconductor industry in Berlin Neukölln 
Remuneration according to company collective agreement (with IG Metall) including 13th monthly salary and variable remuneration components 
Working hours 37 hours/week; reduction to 35 hours/week by October 2025 
Flexible working hours and the option of working remotely from anywhere 
Reimbursement of moving expenses for you and your family 
Specific advanced training and development opportunities 
Access to organized childcare and vacation care 
Health and sports offers (e.g. subsidy for sports activities, health days, company doctor, free vaccinations, etc.) 
Travel allowance for BVG company ticket or bicycle

title: Junior SSA & Flight Dynamics Engineer
description:
About the job
Your mission

Join us in safeguarding the sustainability of space operations through advanced space situational awareness (SSA) technologies. As part of our team, you will develop cutting-edge collision avoidance algorithms, enhance space situational awareness, and innovate tools for satellite operators. Your expertise in data science and physics will help us detect, predict, and mitigate orbital risks, ensuring safe and sustainable space exploration.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities

You will collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of aerospace engineers, data scientists, and software developers to integrate and optimize third-party sensor data sources within our SSA platform. Your contributions will directly enhance the accuracy, automation, and scalability of our orbital risk management solutions.
Integrate third-party data sources into our platform, working closely with providers to seamlessly onboard their data.
Develop, implement, and optimize high-precision algorithms for orbit propagation, orbit determination (OD), sensor fusion, covariance modelling, and uncertainty quantification.
Develop methods to fuse data from diverse sources into one common image of the space debris environment.
Conduct validation and verification (V&V) campaigns to benchmark and refine algorithmic performance against ground truth datasets.
Work closely with software engineers to transition prototype algorithms into scalable, production-ready solutions.

Your profile

Must-have

M.Sc. or higher in Aerospace Engineering, Space Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Applied Physics, or a closely related field, or have prior work experience in the field of SSA/SST or Space Flight Dynamics.
A minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience is required. However, candidates with outstanding profiles may be considered with at least 3 years of experience.
Strong theoretical and practical knowledge of astrodynamics, orbital mechanics, and flight dynamics.
Experience in scientific programming using at least one of the following languages: Java, Fortran (90+) or Python.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative, and research-driven environment.
This position is only open to candidates currently based in Germany or willing to relocate.
Valid working permit for Germany/EU.

Nice-to-have:

Hands-on experience with space surveillance and tracking (SST) systems, including sensor tasking and catalog maintenance.
Experience working with space agencies or private space companies in the SSA/SST field.
Familiarity with space surveillance and tracking systems.
Understanding of space policy and compliance frameworks.
Experience with AI/ML applications for anomaly detection, pattern recognition, or orbit prediction in SSA applications.
Interest in contributing to the sustainability of space and long-term spaceflight operations.

Why us?

With a lean hierarchy and small working groups, you define your own way of work including flexible work hours.
Work on groundbreaking space sustainability challenges with a team of top-tier engineers and scientists.
After your on-boarding time in Braunschweig, you can choose between staying in our office, working remote (within Germany) or a hybrid approach.
Enjoy technical freedom. Influence system architecture, research methodologies, and data integration approaches.
Grow continuously with access to training budgets, industry conferences, and networking opportunities.
Be part of a strong engineering culture, with regular knowledge-sharing sessions, technical deep dives, and innovation sprints.
Great team spirit, with company-wide events such as monthly all-hands lunches, and social activities like laser tag, dinners, and team-building outings.

About Us

OKAPI:Orbits is at the forefront of space sustainability, addressing some of the most pressing challenges of the space industry: the growing problem of crowded orbital regimes, and the need for more efficient satellite operations. We're providing end-to-end solutions that help various space industry players cover their Space Situation Awareness (SSA), and Space Traffic Management and Coordination (STM & STC) needs. We are committed to safeguarding space missions and access to space for all humanity. Join us on our mission.
